body:
How's that? I've just tried MSSQL 2015:

``` sql
create table A (
    id int
);
```

Creates null-able column as expected.

In MSSQL 2008

``` sql
create table B (
   name varchar(10)
);
```

name is created as NOT NULL by default

Apparently there are two scenarios in which the columns are created as not null by default:
- When SET ANSI_NULL_DFLT_ON is Set On
- When ANSI_NULL_DEFAULT setting of the database is Set to OFF and BOTH SET and SET ANSI_NULL_DFLT_ON ANSI_NULL_DFLT_ON are Set to OFF

http://sqlstudies.com/2014/03/31/default-nullability-of-a-new-column/
I see. Yes, I agree that it should be adjusted. Need to check how all supported DBs behave with `NULL`.
Oracle, SQLite and Cubrid are ok with it too.

issue.title: Changes to ColumnSchemaBuilder

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body: Solve `not null` migration problem with some databases. #10422

body: Revered proposed fix because of tests break. It doesn't behave well with primary keys.

Since we can't change `notNull` behavior, i think adding a method `null` or `nullable` to 
explicitly set the column nullability is the best solution, plus it is not bc breaking.
